docs.snippet: The World Anti-Doping Agency and Court of Arbitration for Sport say they have been targeted by hackers, with an attempt made to obtain access credentials for the database which tracks athletes for drug testing....
docs.lead_paragraph: The World Anti-Doping Agency and Court of Arbitration for Sport say they have been targeted by hackers, with an attempt made to obtain access credentials for the database which tracks athletes for drug testing.

headline.main: Hackers Target World Anti-Doping Agency, Sports Court
headline.print_headline: Hackers Target World Anti-Doping Agency, Sports Court

docs.snippet: When Lily Zhang, the American table tennis ace, decided she wanted to make her sport a priority, she took a year off from college to devote to practice, including three months playing with pros in Austria. It paid off, landing her on the Olympic t...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Lily Zhang, the American table tennis ace, decided she wanted to make her sport a priority, she took a year off from college to devote to practice, including three months playing with pros in Austria. It paid off, landing her on the Olympic team for the second time.

headline.main: In Quest for World-Class US Table Tennis, College the Enemy
headline.print_headline: In Quest for World-Class US Table Tennis, College the Enemy

docs.snippet: The United States show jumping team arrived in Rio determined to get back on a gold medal winning streak that ended in London in 2012, when the team finished off the podium for the first time since 2000....

headline.main: U.S. Show Jumpers Seek 2012 Redemption in Rio

headline.main: Sevens and Olympics Collide, Rugby Makes an Impact From Rio

docs.snippet: Doping in athletics could be slashed overnight if sponsors showed any will to eradicate it, according to Steve Magness, the coach who blew the whistle on an elite Nike-sponsored athletics program but now feels like a pariah in the sport as a resul...
docs.lead_paragraph: Doping in athletics could be slashed overnight if sponsors showed any will to eradicate it, according to Steve Magness, the coach who blew the whistle on an elite Nike-sponsored athletics program but now feels like a pariah in the sport as a result.

headline.main: Sponsors Missing From Action in War on Doping: Whistleblower
headline.print_headline: Sponsors Missing From Action in War on Doping: Whistleblower

docs.snippet: After a 92-year wait, rugby is on the cusp of making a full-time return to the Olympics, World Rugby chiefs said on Thursday at the close of the inaugural Rio sevens tournament which has been scrutinised by the gatekeepers of the Games....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a 92-year wait, rugby is on the cusp of making a full-time return to the Olympics, World Rugby chiefs said on Thursday at the close of the inaugural Rio sevens tournament which has been scrutinised by the gatekeepers of the Games.

headline.main: Successful Rio Return Gives Rugby Confidence in Games Future
headline.print_headline: Successful Rio Return Gives Rugby Confidence in Games Future

docs.snippet: Her dual citizenship and family ties let Belize, 4,000 miles from the Rio Games, bask in her golden glow....
docs.lead_paragraph: Her dual citizenship and family ties let Belize, 4,000 miles from the Rio Games, bask in her golden glow.
docs.abstract: People of Belize have followed Olympic fortunes of gymnast Simone Biles with great interest, in light of her dual United States-Belize citizenship; Biles is connected to country through her step-grandmother.

headline.main: Simone Biles Soars, Lifting Another Country With Her
headline.print_headline: As Biles Soars, a Tiny Country Rises With Her

docs.snippet: The Pacific Island nation of Fiji erupted into celebration on Friday after its rugby sevens team defeated Britain to capture the country's first Olympic medal. The fact it was gold made it even more of a reason to party....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pacific Island nation of Fiji erupted into celebration on Friday after its rugby sevens team defeated Britain to capture the country's first Olympic medal. The fact it was gold made it even more of a reason to party.
